chapter.title: The scratchpad
chapter.para: This chapter describes how to use the Scratchpad feature of the &FPA;.

Use the scratchpad as an overlay on your depiction, like a piece of Plexiglas that you can write on and see through. You can use it to make notations that you do not want to remain permanently on the depictions.
To display the scratchpad controls, click the Scratchpad tab.
The scratchpad Function area determines the function used. (see ) Scratchpad panel

sect2.title: Drawing on your scratchpad
sect2.para: scratchpad You can use the Draw Line function to draw lines on the scratchpad in a variety of colours and styles.

listitem.para: From the Function area, select Draw Line. Scratchpad line draw menus appear. (see )
From the Mode menu, select a drawing mode by clicking the rectangle to the right of the icon.
From the Line Colour & Style area, select a colour. The colour bar indicates the selection.
From the Line Colour & Style area, select a line style.
Draw a line. (See or .)
When you are finished, the line appears in the chosen colour and style.

orderedlist.title: To place text on your scratchpad:

listitem.para: From the Function area, select Place Text. Scratchpad text menus appear (see ) Scratchpad text menus
Select the text size, font type and colour for the text.
Note: The point sizes are relative; if you resize a window, the size of the text scales accordingly.
Click Set.
An entry dialog box appears.
Type your text.
Click Set.
Click where you want the text to appear on the scratchpad.
The text appears, centred at the point where you clicked.

orderedlist.title: To measure a "Great Circle" distance on your scratchpad:

listitem.para: From the Function area, select Measure Distance. Scratchpad measure distance menus appear. (see ) Scratchpad measure distance menus
From the Distance Value area, select the text size and font type and colour for the distance label.
Note: The point sizes are relative; if you resize a window, the size of the text scales accordingly.
From the Line Colour & Style area, select a colour and line style for the distance line.
Click the &left; mouse button on the map where you would like to start the measure.
Click the &left; mouse button on the map where you would like to end the measure.
Note: You can &left; click, hold and drag the distance measure. Release the &left; mouse button when you have the desired distance.
The distance and bearing appear on the scratchpad.

orderedlist.title: To measure a preset "Great Circle" distance on your scratchpad:

listitem.para: From the Function area, select Preset Distance. Scratchpad preset distance menus appear. (see ) Scratchpad preset distance menus
Set the Distance value in kilometres. Use the up and down arrows to increase or decrease the distance by a set amount or click inside the text area and type a specific value.
From the Distance Value area, select the text size and font type and colour for the distance label.
Note: The point sizes are relative; if you resize a window, the size of the text scales accordingly.
From the Line Colour & Style area, select a colour and line style for the distance line.
Click the &left; mouse button on the map where you would like to start the measure.
Click the &left; mouse button on the map to indicate the bearing.
Note: You can &left; click, hold and drag the distance measure to the desired bearing.
The distance and bearing appear on the scratchpad.
From the Function area, select Select Items.
Point to the item and click the &left; mouse button to select it. Selected items turn yellow. (Click the &left; mouse button near the item again to deselect it.)
Click the &right; mouse button and select Delete.
From the Function area, select Select Items.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Select All or click Select All on the right panel.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Delete.

orderedlist.title: To display the scratchpad while viewing a depiction:

listitem.para: Choose ViewShow Scratchpad. scratchpadshow
The scratchpad appears on top of your depiction.
To remove the scratchpad, deselect ViewShow Scratchpad. scratchpadhide
